programme.title: Born to Battle
programme.desc: Cattlemen offer a jailed cowboy his freedom if he will agree to help locate a gang of notorious rustlers.

programme.title: Broadway to Cheyenne
programme.desc: A New York police officer, shot and wounded by a gangster, travels to Cheyenne, Wyo., to recuperate at his family's ranch, and is surprised to find a bootlegger from New York running a speakeasy there.

programme.title: Law of the Pampas
programme.desc: Hopalong Cassidy (William Boyd) and his sidekick (Russell Hayden) head for South America to deliver cattle.

programme.title: With Sitting Bull at the Spirit Lake Massacre
programme.desc: Chief Sitting Bull surveys the settlement at Spirit Lake from afar and vows to retake the land that once belonged to his forefathers.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Hoss' bandit uncle (Neville Brand) decides to bypass the Ponderosa, but his gang disagrees.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Hoss and Little Joe spend a most unforgettable night at the carnival when Little Joe's date disappears.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Ben gives farmland on the Ponderosa to an outcast Indian (Ricardo Montalban) who saved his life; guest Madlyn Rhue.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: An outlaw joins the Cartwrights' cattle drive, knowing it will take him to the town where his father is sheriff.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Attacked by Shoshones while crossing a burial ground, Adam discovers that the "Indian" woman tending him is white.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Little Joe runs into romantic complications when he tries to teach a deaf girl (Stella Stevens) sign language; guest Albert Salmi.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.sub-title: A Night at the Hooterville Hilton
programme.desc: A brochure for the Shady Rest Hotel of the future is prematurely distributed.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Homer plans to keep the Cannonball from making its Christmas caroling tour.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Herby Bates, who is sweet on Billie Jo, won't be seeing much more of her, he has just been drafted.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Bobbie Jo falls for Alan Landman (Dennis Hopper), a poet and beatnik.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Billie Jo discovers that her late father wanted her to be a doctor.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Kate asks the judge if she can legally keep Billie Jo from going to Hollywood.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: A movie star escapes from the Hollywood madness in Shady Rest.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Uncle Joe convinces two overweight women that the Shady Rest is really a reducing farm, where their loss is management's gain.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Railroad executive Homer Bedloe arrives in Hooterville with a railroad tycoon, who is determined to purchase the Cannonball.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: A man travels to Hooterville to investigate a line connection.

programme.title: Custer's Last Stand
programme.desc: The search for a missing medicine arrow sparks a series of Indian attacks. Feature version of the serial.

programme.title: Enemy of the Law
programme.desc: Former Texas Ranger Tex Haines (Tex Ritter), now an attorney, is called back into law enforcement by his old pals Dave Wyatt (Dave O'Brien) and Panhandle Perkins (Guy Wilkerson), who want his help recovering some stolen gold.

programme.title: The Lucky Texan
programme.desc: Jerry Mason (John Wayne) and his friend Jake (George Hayes) have to keep two crooks away from their gold.

programme.title: The Deadly Companions
programme.desc: An ex-army officer accidentally kills a woman's son, and tries to make up for it by escorting the funeral procession through dangerous Indian territory.

programme.title: Between Men
programme.desc: A blacksmith's son (Johnny Mack Brown) goes to New Mexico to find his benefactor's (William Farnum) disinherited granddaughter (Beth Marion).

programme.title: Buffalo Stampede
programme.desc: Buffalo hide trader Tom Doan must track down and outsmart a gang of white thieves disguised as raiding American Indians to save the woman he loves.

programme.title: Brothers of the West
programme.desc: Detective Tom Wade (Tom Tyler) has to investigate the truth behind a robbery and murder of a bank president that's being blamed on Tom's brother, Ed (Bob Terry), who is nowhere to be found.
